intro: Hieracium nordmarkense, commonly known as the Nordmark hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to northern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring moist, well-drained soils. It produces yellow flowers with ray florets and is known for its hairy stems and leaves. Hieracium nordmarkense is often found in areas with moderate climates and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens.
